item.description: 美国国债止跌反弹，因为交易员们在为本周的大量债券销售做准备。【原文：US Treasuries halted their rally as traders braced for a hefty slate of bond sales this week.】

item.title: 纽约市音乐场所运营商 Avant Gardner 申请破产
item.description: 纽约市现场音乐演出场所运营商前卫加德纳公司（Avant Gardner）在对其旗舰室外舞台布鲁克林幻影（Brooklyn Mirage）进行大规模翻修后，在重新开业时遇到困难，现已申请破产保护。【原文：New York City live music venue operator Avant Gardner has filed for bankruptcy protection after difficulties re-opening its flagship outdoor stage, the Brooklyn Mirage, following a major renovation.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的威尔逊表示，因盈利强劲而买入股价下跌的股票
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）策略师迈克尔-威尔逊（Michael Wilson）认为，由于来年盈利前景强劲，投资者应该买入抛售的美股。【原文：Investors should buy into the selloff in US stocks because of the robust earnings outlook for the coming year, according to Morgan Stanley strategist Michael Wilson.】

item.description:

item.description: 上周的经济数据与公司高管和消费者长期以来对今年经济的描述不谋而合：闪现出一些警示信号。【原文：Last week’s economic data caught up with the kind of economy that company executives and consumers have long described this year: flashing some warning signs.】

item.title: 欧盟等待特朗普本周对其汽车关税和豁免采取行动
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧盟预计美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将于本周宣布行政措施，正式降低欧盟的汽车关税，并对航空零部件等一些工业产品免征关税。【原文：The European Union is expecting US President Donald Trump to announce executive actions this week to formalize the bloc’s lower tariffs for cars and grant exemptions from levies for some industrial goods such as aviation parts, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 瑞银计划利用从瑞士信贷继承的项目进行 SRT 交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）正在就潜在的重大风险转移向投资者发出呼声，因为这家银行巨头正在探索如何减轻瑞士政府提出的更高资本要求所带来的影响。【原文：UBS Group AG is sounding out investors for a potential significant risk transfer, according to people familiar with the matter, as the banking giant explores ways to mitigate the impact of higher capital requirements proposed by the Swiss government.】

item.title: 香港新上市规则被认为有助于热门市场保持热度
item.description: 香港对其上市规则的修改很可能为全球最热门的首次公开募股市场之一保持更长时间的热度铺平道路。【原文：Hong Kong’s changes to its listing rules are likely to pave the way for one of the world’s hottest markets for initial public offerings to stay hot for longer.】

item.title: 花旗看跌黄金，转而看涨美国经济增长和通胀担忧
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.）修改了其看跌黄金的预测，分析师们现在预测，由于美国经济恶化和通胀促进关税，金银将在短期内反弹至历史新高。【原文：Citigroup Inc. revised its bearish forecast for gold, with analysts now predicting bullion will rally to a record high in the near term due to a worsening US economy and inflation-boosting tariffs.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德聘请价值 3200 亿美元的基金前首席执行官担任沙特主席
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）已聘请沙特阿拉伯价值 3200 亿美元的养老基金管理公司的前首席执行官担任其在沙特的新任董事长，该公司已在沙特达成了一系列交易，最近还成立了一个新的投资机构。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management has hired the former chief executive officer of Saudi Arabia’s $320 billion pension fund manager as its new chairman in the kingdom where it has inked a series of deals and recently set up a new investment vehicle.】

item.title: 新加坡政府投资公司收购马索兰热-泽戈纳宽带合资企业 25% 的股份
item.description: 新加坡主权财富基金 GIC Pte. 已同意购买 Masorange SL 和沃达丰西班牙公司拥有的一家光纤合资企业 25% 的股份。【原文：Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund GIC Pte. has agreed to buy a 25% stake in a fiber joint venture owned by Masorange SL and Vodafone Spain.】

item.title: 花旗从高盛和德意志银行招聘人员，发展亚洲投资银行
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.）在亚洲招聘了两名关键人才，以加强对金融赞助商及其债务资本市场业务的覆盖，这是该投资银行近期一系列高级任命的补充。【原文：Citigroup Inc. made two key hires in Asia to boost coverage of financial sponsors and its debt capital markets business, adding to a string of recent senior appointments within the investment bank.】

item.title: 欧洲股市上涨，瑞士股市因美国冲击性关税而下跌
item.description: 欧洲股市开盘上涨，而瑞士股市则下跌，因为交易商们首次有机会对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对瑞士征收 39% 的惩罚性出口关税做出反应。【原文：European shares opened higher, while the Swiss market slumped as traders had their first opportunity to react to US President Donald Trump’s punitive 39% export tariff on the country.】

item.title: 中国香港 ETF 因逢低买进热潮出现创纪录资金流入
item.description: 中国投资者利用香港股市近期回落的机会大举建仓，向追踪香港股市的交易所交易基金投入了创纪录的资金。【原文：Chinese investors have taken advantage of a recent pullback in Hong Kong stocks to accumulate positions, pouring a record amount of money into exchange-traded funds that track the market.】

item.title: 汽车金融法庭裁决 "大获全胜 "后，英国放贷人反弹
item.description: 劳埃德银行集团（Lloyds Banking Group Plc）、Close Brothers 集团（Close Brothers Group Plc）和巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）等英国贷款机构的股票周一大涨，因为该行业在英国最高法院审理的一桩关键的英国汽车金融案件中赢得了重大缓刑。【原文：Shares of UK lenders including Lloyds Banking Group Plc, Close Brothers Group Plc and Barclays Plc jumped on Monday after the industry won a major reprieve in a pivotal UK car finance case before the country’s top court.】

item.title: 油轮不顾美国和欧盟压力向印度运送俄罗斯原油
item.description: 周末，至少有四艘油轮在印度炼油厂卸下了数百万桶俄罗斯原油，这表明，即使美国加大了对南亚国家停止购买俄罗斯原油的压力，但受到严格审查的俄罗斯原油运输仍在正常进行。【原文：At least four tankers discharged millions of barrels of Russian crude at Indian refineries at the weekend, a sign the closely scrutinized deliveries are continuing as normal, even as the US ramps up pressure on the South Asian country to stop purchases.】

item.title: 从雅典转战伦敦后，梅特伦公司股票首次亮相即上涨
item.description: Metlen Energy and Metals Plc 公司周一在伦敦证券交易所首次上市时上涨，此前该公司为寻找新的投资者，将主要上市地从雅典迁至伦敦。【原文：Metlen Energy and Metals Plc rose in its debut on the London Stock Exchange on Monday after moving its primary listing from Athens in search of new investors.】

item.title: 土耳其 7 月通胀率超预期降至 33.5%
item.description: 土耳其上个月的通胀放缓幅度超过预期，这给上个月决定恢复降息的货币政策制定者带来了鼓舞。【原文：Turkish inflation slowed more than expected last month, giving a boost to monetary policymakers after last month’s decision to resume interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司股价暴跌，溢价率逊于西方竞争对手
item.description: 长期以来，沙特阿美一直是世界上最大的石油公司，但今年它却成为同行中股价表现最差的公司。【原文：Saudi Aramco has long been the world’s biggest oil company, but this year it gained the distinction of having the worst-performing shares among its peers.】

item.title: 美国加征关税，南非将加强大陆贸易关系
item.description: 南非计划为其商品寻求新的市场，以抵消华盛顿对进入美国的南非商品征收 30% 关税对其出口造成的影响。【原文：South Africa plans to seek new markets for its goods to offset the impact on its exports from Washington’s imposition of 30% tariffs on the nation’s goods entering the US.】

item.title: 2025 年上半年日本食品出口创历史新高
item.description: 据日本农业部称，2025 年前六个月日本食品出口额达到 8097 亿日元（55 亿美元），创历史新高。【原文：Japanese food exports in the first six months of 2025 hit a record high of ¥809.7 billion ($5.5 billion) according to the agriculture ministry.】

item.title: 交易员担心美国关税影响，瑞士股票期货下跌
item.description: 瑞士股票指数期货周一下跌，因为证券交易所准备在假期后重新开市，并将美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对瑞士征收 39% 的惩罚性出口关税的影响计入价格。【原文：Swiss stock-index futures dropped Monday as the stock exchange prepared to reopen after a holiday, pricing in the impact of US President Donald Trump’s punitive 39% export tariff on the country.】

item.title: 瑞士通胀意外加快，为瑞士央行提供喘息机会
item.description: 瑞士通胀意外加快，正在考虑是否重新引入负利率的政策制定者对此表示欢迎。【原文：Swiss inflation unexpectedly accelerated, a reading that will be welcomed by policymakers mulling whether to reintroduce negative interest rates.】

item.title: 西非可可作物再次减产将使价格居高不下
item.description: 作为世界顶级可可生产国的所在地，西非大部分地区正迎来又一个令人失望的收获季节。尽管天气好于往年，但结构性问题（如树木老化和作物病害）可能会继续限制产量，并使价格居高不下。【原文：Much of West Africa, home to the world’s top cocoa producers, is heading into another disappointing harvest. Despite better weather than in previous seasons, structural problems — such as aging trees and crop diseases — may continue to limit output and keep prices high.】
